noun.description: A small to medium-sized primate that typically has a long tail, most kinds of which live in trees in tropical countries.
A pile-driving machine consisting of a heavy hammer or ram working vertically in a groove.

verb.description: Behave in a silly or playful way.

phrases: He blazed it wide and missed the target again after making a monkey of Neilson and cutting inside dangerously.
I was wrong, you finally made a monkey out of me.
Desmond said, You'll never make a monkey out of me!
I could make a monkey out of you, but why should I take all the credit?
With his back to goal, he made a monkey out of Desailly by turning him inside out before blasting the ball wide from about three yards out.
origin: Mid 16th century: of unknown origin, perhaps from Low German.
